Text: Fwd EOTT PL Tanks compliance databaseBill Glushko To CC Subject EOTT PL Tanks compliance database Date Thu Jun Latest tank list complete unless you request otherwise Note that this list includes tanks that are still standing regardless of whether they are inactive or permanently out of service There are sites which are affected by Texas annual inspection fees with a cost of but possibly after checking the tank strapping tables might reduce to These fees would be due by each year if the tank was operated during the previous Fiscal Year Sep Aug The Teams told me that electric pumps are the norm at EOTT PL tank farms Crane has a Title V permit but there were no combustion sources that would cause another site to exceed TPY The Texas tanks subject to NSPS K Ka or Kb are subject to an emissions fee unless they are subject to an inspection fee and it is higher In Texas EP facilities crude oil and refined product pipelines natural gas and LPG are regulated by the Railroad Commission However TNRCC has jurisdiction over the petroleum bulk stations SIC code for a petroleum bulk station is for a crude pipeline is SIC either as a primary or secondary code is correct and it generates a TNRCC inspection fee for of the sites Designating a code andor paying an inspection fee will get the facility more attention from the state inspectors The need to document years recordkeeping required tank seal inspections becomes critical For TNRCC inspectors in south and east Texas seal inspections on petroleum storage tanks with floatingroofs have been an item of interest for some time There is even a requirement to notify the local environmental agency days in advance of refilling a floating roof tank or measuring the seal gap It is likely that the EOTT stations have not been inspected because of the changes in ownership use of only SIC code no TNRCC account number assigned and no inspectionemissions fee paid But sometime sooner than later the inspector will come and you want to be ready Larry I am very familiar with what is required with your crude stations and am finalizing a memo which will specify exactly what is needed I recommend you move forward with the sugggested changes With regard to the seal inspections I can do them or I can show you what youll need for compliance Let me know Thanks Bill Glushko Argent Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at EOTT PL Tks xls

EOTT PL tank list fees revised listing assumes SIC only For rationale for not classifying as please see Memo para Currently Im collecting required info so that the TNRCC Region can assign an account numbers for the tank sites that need them I received the API yesterday and inserted the addendum pages Its an excellent reference but doesnt focus on complianceenvironmental aspects You only need general familiarity so reading Section and Appendix C Inservice is plenty right now In your spare time haha try to look over the page InService tank inspection checklist I sent you and see if it makes sense For about years Ive used this item checklist combined with the IFREFR inspection report and a seal gap measurement sketch In my opinion its all you need right now Next week Ill put the site questionnaire together Any questions for me Bill Glushko Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at EOTT PL Tks feesxls Memo compliance summarydoc tankinspxls

Re TNRCC Account Numbersaround Ill call Unless you object Ill use EPAs TANKS program to calculate annual emissions and emission fees ton for the sites that have a tank subject to NSPS KKaKb This wont take long Im a little anxious about McElroy tank From To Bill Glushko Subject Re TNRCC Account Numbers Date Fri Aug Bill give me about two weeks and give me a call Im going on a business road trip and wont be back in the office much Thanks Bill Glushko on PM To cc Subject Re TNRCC Account Numbers Larry the account number for Sands station is DCS I would like to discuss McElroy when you have a moment May prefer to wait on that one bill glushko From To CC Subject TNRCC Account Numbers Date Mon Aug Bill how is the TNRCC account number coming along for the McElory EOTT site By the way good job on the notebook This email is the property of Enron Corp andor its relevant affiliate and may contain confidential and privileged material for the sole use of the intended recipient s Any review use distribution or disclosure by others is strictly prohibited If you are not the intended recipient or authorized to receive for the recipient please contact the sender or reply to Enron Corp at and delete all copies of the message This email and any attachments hereto are not intended to be an offer or an acceptance and do not create or evidence a binding and enforceable contract between Enron Corp or any of its affiliates and the intended recipient or any other party and may not be relied on by anyone as the basis of a contract by estoppel or otherwise Thank you Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at intlasp Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at intlasp

EOTT PL tank list fees revised listing assumes SIC only For rationale for not classifying as please see Memo para Currently Im collecting required info so that the TNRCC Region can assign an account numbers for the tank sites that need them I received the API yesterday and inserted the addendum pages Its an excellent reference but doesnt focus on complianceenvironmental aspects You only need general familiarity so reading Section and Appendix C Inservice is plenty right now In your spare time haha try to look over the page InService tank inspection checklist I sent you and see if it makes sense For about years Ive used this item checklist combined with the IFREFR inspection report and a seal gap measurement sketch In my opinion its all you need right now Next week Ill put the site questionnaire together Any questions for me Bill Glushko Get your FREE download of MSN Explorer at EOTT PL Tks feesxls Memo compliance summarydoc tankinspxls
